Message.Msg: PJ: I warned that POMO + window dressing would prop the markets and Amazon. Having said that, it is falling short of GeeGee's hopes. At some point, the public will get very angry because of the pain it feels while Bernanke gives free trading profits (this isn't investing as I've said... more disconnected from investment valuations everyday -- AAPL/AMZN and WMT&TGT/AMZN). The public knows intuitively that the Fed is inflating bank earnings (today via POMO trading profits and in the future on interest on excess reserves). The Fed Chairman is using omission to avoid lying. Byfocusing on timing, he hides the arbitrage profits that are being handed to the sector when the eventual impact and thus wealth transfer are clear even today.

Message.Title: With Max Pain at $265 for Friday, Option scam manipulators made their move and pinned it today
Message.Msg: $6 run betwwn 10:21a to 10:39a - very impressive manipulation, albiet on low volume. 400k shares bought during the run (~$105M) drove up the market cap by $2.8B (good bang for their buck), and saved millions in option payout.

Topic.Title: Funny watching the AAPL cash dillemna: other companies should has such problems: this maket chases stocks that dream of making fractions of what AAPL has made

Message.Msg: Exactly. Bernanke talked about the high risk premium. But, it isn't intellectially honest. Companies like AAPL, CSCO, INTC that are a significant fraction of aggregate earnings and market cap are making it look low. There are massive bubbles in this market where option scalping has become a major source of trading profits / financial earnings. Meanwhile, INVESTORS in these companies are penalized because they are not seeing the capital appreciation as they are held back to sell calls, while the N/A crew is propped up to sell puts. Just look at multiples as a function of control of float and it becomes clear. None of the Fed money is going to productove investment (whch is generally illiquid). Almost all is going to fuel this scam...

Topic.Title: Short interest down again...

Message.Msg: I agree, the stock pop right after they missed last earnings, then slowly tanking. Major money holding this stock, now they are getting out, orderly exiting and leaving retail investors holding the bag, on the expenses of 401ks, pension funds that buy the tech index like QQQ.

Topic.Title: Short interest down again...

Message.Msg: The tanking of large cap, low multiple tech after November 15th was purposeful IMHO. By dumping those and pumping these, they got all the index trackers to load up on scams at high levels and to sell those at low valuations. That lever has already been pulled about as hard as it can be. Someday, someone will look into how that was engineered. It was not a natural event...

When everone decides the game is rigger, they choose to play a game they can win (investing locally in private companies and physical assets) even if the wins are smaller than to play a game where only the house (casino) wins because it is playing with an infitinite bankroll of Bernanke bux to move the stock in ways completely disconnected to the economic reality. One cannot explain the AAPL/AMZN move as anything other than predatory. It will be a fine case study in glorified theft...
